title: Former SEC Championship Game logo font(s)
content:
Can anyone help me find which font is close to the following former SEC logos:

a.) 2001 SEC Championship Game (emphasis on 'SEC' and 'Championship')  
b.) 2002 SEC Championship Game (emphasis on 'SEC' and 'Championship')  
c.) 2003 SEC Championship Game (emphasis on 'SEC' and 'Championship')

It would be much appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [2001SECChamplogo.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073057/http:/typophile.com/files/2001SECChamplogo.png) | 17.11 KB |
| [2002SECChamplogo.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073057/http:/typophile.com/files/2002SECChamplogo.png) | 39.7 KB |
| [2003SECChamplogo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073057/http:/typophile.com/files/2003SECChamplogo.jpg) | 27.8 KB |
author: jlog3000

comments.content: Try [Serpentine](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073057/http:/www.identifont.com/show?3Q9) for a similar lookalike (especially the S)…

Looks very close to it, except the small pointy serifs not being there. Must be a sans-serif variation of Serpentine. I guess it's nearly modified on width or length, at least on the vertical bars on the 'S', 'E' and 'C'. And what about the font on 'CHAMPIONSHIP'?

> Must be a sans-serif variation of Serpentine

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/serpentine-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073057/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/serpentine-sans/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/serpentine-sans/")
